H0.text: name of volcano that erupted in iceland in 2010. Katla

H1.text: name of volcano that erupted in iceland in 2010. Hekla

H2.text: name of volcano that erupted in iceland in 2010. Grímsvötn

H3.text: name of volcano that erupted in iceland in 2010. Eyjafjallajökull

A4.text: On 14 April 2010 Eyjafjallajökull resumed erupting after a brief pause, this time from the top crater in the centre of the glacier, causing jökulhlaup (meltwater floods) to rush down the nearby rivers, and requiring 800 people to be evacuated.

A5.text: The eruption began on 20 March 2010, about 8 km (5 mi) east of the top crater of the volcano, on Fimmvörðuháls, the high neck between Eyjafjallajökull and the neighbouring icecap, Mýrdalsjökull.
